Plot predictions from a classification model

Plot predictions from a classification model

plot_classification_predictions(x, title = NULL,
  fill_colors = c("firebrick", "steelblue"), fill_alpha = 0.7,
  curve_flex = 1, font_size = 11, target)

Arguments

x

hcai_predicted_df from plot.hcai_predicted_df
title

Character: Plot title, default NULL produces no title.
fill_colors

Length-2 character vector: colors to fill density curves. Default is c("firebrick", "steelblue"). If named, names must match unique(x[[target]]), in any order.
fill_alpha

Number in [0, 1] giving opacity of fill colors.
curve_flex

Numeric. Kernal adjustment for density curves. Default is 1. Less than 1 makes curves more flexible, analogous to smaller bins in a histogram; greater than 1 makes curves more rigid.
font_size

Number: Relative size of all font in plot, default = 11
target

outcome column name

Value

ggplot object

Details

This function is not meant to be called directly. Use plot(predictions) instead. You can pass arguments to this function (e.g. a plot title) through plot.

Contents

  • Value
